Class Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener

java.lang.Object
  jpo.Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener, java.util.EventListener, java.io.Serializable
Enclosing class:
Thumbnail
private class Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener, java.io.Serializable

This class extends a DragSourceListener for tracking the drag operation originating from this thumbnail.

Constructor Summary
private Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener()
           
 
Method Summary
 void dragDropEnd(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDropEvent event)
          this callback message goes to DragSourceListener, informing it that the dragging has ended.
 void dragEnter(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
          this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the drag event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event.
 void dragExit(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceEvent event)
          this callback method is invoked to tell the dragSource that the drag has moved on to something else.
 void dragOver(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
          this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the dragOver event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event.
 void dropActionChanged(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
          this callback method is invoked when the user presses or releases shift when doing a drag.

Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener

private Thumbnail.ThumbnailDragSourceListener()
Method Detail

dragEnter

public void dragEnter(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the drag event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event. This method sets the cursor to reflect whether a copy, move or no drop is possible.

Specified by:
dragEnter in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dragOver

public void dragOver(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the dragOver event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event. This method sets the cursor to reflect whether a copy, move or no drop is possible.

Specified by:
dragOver in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dragExit

public void dragExit(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceEvent event)
this callback method is invoked to tell the dragSource that the drag has moved on to something else.

Specified by:
dragExit in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dropActionChanged

public void dropActionChanged(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked when the user presses or releases shift when doing a drag. He can signal that he wants to change the copy / move of the operation.

Specified by:
dropActionChanged in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dragDropEnd

public void dragDropEnd(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDropEvent event)
this callback message goes to DragSourceListener, informing it that the dragging has ended.

Specified by:
dragDropEnd in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener
